means: 逗弄，引诱，折磨( tantalize的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: This was my first tantalizing glimpse of the islands.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是我第一眼看见的这些岛屿的动人美景.

sentence.Network_en: We have only vague and tantalizing glimpses of his power.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们只能隐隐约约地领略他的威力,的确有一种可望不可及的感觉.

sentence.Network_en: The younger woman could almost smell the tantalizing aroma of purple lilacs.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位年轻妇女几乎嗅到了紫丁香诱人的芬芳.

entry.tran: 使(某人)想要却得不到(某物);逗引;挑逗;撩拨
entry.def: If someone or something tantalizes you, they make you feel hopeful and excited about getting what you want, usually before disappointing you by not letting you have what they appeared to offer.

example.ex: The boy would come into the room and tantalize the dog with his feed.
example.tran: 那个男孩会到房间里拿狗食逗弄狗。

example.ex: ...the dreams of democracy that have so tantalized them.
example.tran: 他们可望而不可即的民主梦想

means.word_mean: 1. arousing desire or expectation for something unattainable or mockingly out of reach;
